bibl.title: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, November 11, 1940

div1.p: Clemons acknowledges receipt of the newspaper clipping and the Washington and Jefferson College program. He will preserve these items with the other yellow fever material at Alderman Library at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from Harry Clemons to Philip Showalter Hench, November 11, 1940
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
11 November 1940
HARRY CLEMONS
LIBRARIAN
MARY LOUISE DINWIDDIE
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
We are very glad to have your
letter of November fourth with the clipping from
the Rochester Post-Bulletin of 28 October 1940 and
the programme of the dinner at Washington and Jef-
ferson College on 26 October 1940. All these will
be preserved with the other yellow fever material;
and we shall await with keen interest the appearance
of the article you propose to publish in a medical
journal. You are making effective contributions to
this intensely interesting subject.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry Clemons
Librarian To Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Avenue, S. W.
Rochester, Minnesota
HC:HCK
3/6/41-
